title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing CSP credit (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When viewing a Credit in View mode, there will be an Edit button and a Close button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Close" will return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the form in edit mode according to the wireframe and data discovery. 
* After a Credit has been saved for the first time, Club users will not be able to edit any of the fields under the "Payment Details" subsection.
* BOC users will continue to be able to edit all of the fields.
* When viewing a Credit in Edit mode, there is a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode and no changes will be saved. 
* Clicking "Save" will save any changes made to the CSP's credit. 
* A successful blue save notification will display. 

*Missed AC from create stories, please test*
* When creating a new credit clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the changes will be lost and they will be taken back to their point of entry.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing CSP credit (Pre 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When viewing a Credit in View mode, there will be an Edit button and a Close button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Close" will return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the form in edit mode according to the wireframe and data discovery. 
* After a Credit has been saved for the first time, Club users will not be able to edit any of the fields under the "Payment Details" subsection.
* BOC users will continue to be able to edit all of the fields.
* When viewing a Credit in Edit mode, there is a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode and no changes will be saved. 
* Clicking "Save" will save any changes made to the CSP's credit. 
* A successful blue save notification will display. 

*Missed AC from create stories, please test*
* When creating a new credit clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the changes will be lost and they will be taken back to their point of entry.

title: As a user I want to be able to calculate the living expenses based on the start and end dates entered on a Credit
custom_preconds: Given User is on players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When viewing an Invoice in edit mode where the Living Expenses field is editable, there is a calculator icon available.
custom_expected:
* Clicking on this icon will calculate the living expenses for the invoice by using the entered start date and end date, and multiplying the number of days between the 2 dates by $35. 
* The resulting sum should be populated in the living expenses field. 
* If no start or end date are entered, then this just remains $0.

title: As a user I want to be able to delete a CSP credit
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Club and BOC users with Edit permissions for Credits will see a "Delete" button on Credits in view or edit mode.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Delete" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to confirm the deletion of the item. See Messages #22. 
* Confirming that they wish to delete will permanently delete the credit from the system and return the user to the point of entry and throw a blue notification saying "CSP Credit successfully deleted"
* Clicking No will dismiss the modal.

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing CSP credit (Pre 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a payment history in CSP
custom_steps: WHEN the user clicks on the term in the player's payment history
custom_expected:
THEN this action should launch the Credit for the user. 
AND If the Credit is for a player whose CSP signing date is on or before 10/3/2004, then the system will display the Credit according to the wireframe and data discovery. 
AND The CSP Summary at the top of the Credit should be directly tied to the current information on the player's CSP tab (Not a snapshot). 
AND The CSP Summary section should be collapsed by default

title: As a user I want to see Tuition Allowance Credits and Living Allowance Credits split out separately for credits for CSP's post 10/3/04
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When On Credits for CSPs with a Signing Date after 10/3/2004, there are now going to be 2 separate Credit fields.
custom_expected:
* Credits for CSPs with a Signing Date before 10/3/2004 will remain unchanged with the single Credit field. 
* See the wireframe for placement. 
* Credits will become Tuition Credits and Living Expenses Credits.

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter a Credit containing a Winter Semester
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on a Credit for a CSP with both "Winter" and "Semester" selected
custom_expected: * System will trigger an error. See Messages #23

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP Credit for an Employee
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When viewing the CSP tab of an Employee profile, if the user has the proper permissions, there is a New Credit button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "New Credit" should load the invoice according the wire and data discovery, just like if this was a player. 
* All rules and required field checks should work the same as if this were a player.

title: As a user I want to be able to view an existing CSP credit (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking on the term in the player's Payment History for a credit should launch the Credit for the user.
custom_expected:
* If the Credit is for a player whose CSP signing date is after 10/3/2004, then the system will display the Credit according to the wireframe and data discovery. 
* The CSP Summary at the top of the Credit should be directly tied to the current information on the player's CSP tab (Not a snapshot). 
* The CSP Summary section is collapsed by default

title: As a user I want to be able to view the Payment History on the CSP tab of the player profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is on a CSP Summary screen
custom_expected:
THEN the screen CSP Summary will match the provided wireframe and data discovery, including the Payment History. 
AND If no payments exist hide the Payment History table completely, but leave the Payment History section header

title: As a user I want to be able to search for a CSP School
custom_preconds: GIVEN CSP/CEP School" is an option in the "Search for" dropdown.
custom_steps: WHEN user selects CSP/CEP from the drop down
custom_expected:
THEN this will load the relevant filters according to the provided search requirements. 
AND Conducting an advanced search will return the correct columns and the correct results set based on the filters selected.

title: As a user I want to be edit an existing CSP School Profile
custom_preconds: Given user is on Players CSP school profile
custom_steps: When user viewing an existing CSP School profile
custom_expected:
* View mode should have "Close" Button 
* When viewing an existing CSP School Profile in View mode there is a "Close" button. 
* Clicking "Close" will close the profile and return the user to the point of entry.
* When viewing an existing CSP School Profile, if the user has edit permissions they see an "Edit" button.
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the profile in edit mode, according to the wireframe and the data discovery. 
* In Edit Mode there will be a "Save" button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose changes. If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode with none of the changes saved. If they do not confirm, the modal will close and the form will remain in Edit mode with the changes still in place. 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field and format check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field/format check has passed, the form will be saved and reloaded in View mode. 
* A successful blue save notification will display.

title: School - Permissions
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When User click on CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*This form should share permissions with the CSP Summary - no new LDAP should be created*
* The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.csp
* The form has an edit permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view and edit CSP Schools. Users without the permission cannot edit CSP Schools anywhere in the system.

title: Credit - Permissions
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP TAb
custom_steps: When User Click on CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*This form should share permissions with the CSP Summary - no new LDAP should be created*
* The form has a view only permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view all aspects of the form, but cannot edit anything.  Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.
* The form has an edit permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users with this permission can view and edit CSP Credits. Users without the permission cannot edit CSP Credits anywhere in the system.

title: Invoice - Permissions
custom_steps:
1. WHEN I view an invoice as a view-only account

2. WHEN I view an invoice as a boc account
custom_expected:
1. THEN I can see the invoice and print but not edit

2. THEN I can see, print and edit the invoice

title: Summary - Permissions
custom_steps:
1. WHEN I view a CSP summary as the view-only account

2. WHEN I view a CSP summary as an boc account
custom_expected:
1. THEN I can view and print from the summary

2. THEN I can view, print and edit the summary

title: As a user I don't want to be able to enter a Lapsed Date if the status doesn't allow for it
custom_preconds: Given User is on CSP Summary
custom_steps: When user edits the CSP Summary and enters a Lapsed Date when the status is not set to "Lapsed", clicking "Save" on the CSP Summary
custom_expected:
* System will trigger an error. See Messages #5
* This error will also be triggered on "Save" from an Invoice or a Credit.

title: As a user I want approving a contract with a CSP clause to have a CSP tab in the player profile
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When a MN Contract is approved with a CSP clause in it a CSP record is created for the player.
custom_expected:
* Once the contract has been approved, the player will have a CSP tab on their player profile with a status of "Current". 
* "Responsible Org" will be set to the signing Org. 
* Signing Date will reflect the signing date from the MN Contract. 
* The Living Allowance and Tuition Allowance "Commitments" will be populated using the information entered in the MN Contract's CSP clause. 
* The 10 Year Expiration date will be set to 10 years from the Signing Date.
* Used amounts will all equal 0. 
* Remaining amounts will all equal the committed amounts.

title: As a user I don't want to be able to enter a Living Allowance Completed Date if the status doesn't allow for it
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP summary
custom_steps: When user edits the CSP Summary and enters a Living Allowance Completed Date when the status is not set to "Current, Tuition Allowance Only" or "Completed" or "Lapsed", clicking "Save" on the CSP Summary
custom_expected:
* System will trigger an error. See Messages #8.
* This error will also be triggered on "Save" from an Invoice or a Credit.

title: As a user I don't want to be able to enter a Tuition Allowance Completed Date if the status doesn't allow for it
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP summary
custom_steps: When user edits the CSP Summary and enters a Tuition Allowance Completed Date when the status is not set to "Current, Living Allowance Only" or "Completed" or "Lapsed", clicking "Save" on the CSP Summary
custom_expected:
* System will trigger an error. See Messages #7
* This error will also be triggered on "Save" from an Invoice or a Credit.

title: As a user I want to see a CSP Tab on an Employee Profile if they have a CSP with any status
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_legacy_-_before_10_3_2004

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+Summary

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a CSP exists for an employee profile, the user is able to load that profile, and see a "CSP" tab. 
* This tab will have the same permissions that the tab has on player profiles (not visible to those without it). 
* The tab will only appear for Employees that have a valid CSP.
* Loading the tab will match the wireframe and data discovery (just like the player's CSP tab - including any differences based on signing date).

Employee that has one:  https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/#/pro-player-profile/csp?playerId=29630

title: As a user I don't want to be able to enter a Completed Date if the status doesn't allow for it
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When user edits a CSP Summary with a Completed Date, and enters a Completed Date when the status is not set to "Completed", clicking "Save" on the CSP Summary
custom_expected:
*System will trigger an error. See Messages #6.
* This error will also be triggered on "Save" from an Invoice or a Credit.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the CSP Summary on a professional player profile (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking edit puts the Summary tab into edit mode
custom_expected:
* The CSP Summary tab has an Edit button in view mode. 
* Special attention should be paid to the differences between the versions of CSP, such as the available CSP statuses, Date Completed fields and Net Amount field. Net Amount should NOT be required for contracts with a signing date between 1/12/2005 and 10/3/2004. 
* A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
* Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field check has passed, the changes will be saved and a blue successful save notification will be displayed. The page will reload in View mode. 
* Any changes that were made to the Payment History are reflected in the associated Invoice.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are sure that they wish to lose any changes. If they confirm, the form is put back in view mode and no changes are saved. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and they are returned to the form in edit mode with their changes still present.

title: As a user I want to be able to prepopulate a school's address on an Invoice
custom_preconds: Given user is on players CSP tab
custom_steps: When Selecting the radio button "School" on an Invoice should allow the user to select which of the stored school addresses should be used in the player letter.
custom_expected:
* The school dropdown should be an autocomplete field of all of the available school profiles for CSP. 
* Selecting a school from the dropdown will pre populate the "Addressee", Contact, Fax and Address fields displayed on the invoice using the information entered on the school's profile.
* The user will be able to adjust these pre populated values.

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP Invoice for an Employee
custom_preconds: Given user is on players CSP tab
custom_steps: When viewing the CSP tab of an Employee profile and Click "New Invoice" should load the invoice according the wire and data discovery, just like if this was a player.
custom_expected:
*if the user has the proper permissions, there is a New Invoice button.
* All rules and required field checks should work the same as if this were a player.

title: As a user I want to see Tuition Allowance Credits and Living Allowance Credits split out separately for invoices for CSP's post 10/3/04
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When User On Invoices for CSPs with a Signing Date after 10/3/2004, there are now going to be 2 separate Credit fields.
custom_expected:
* Invoices for CSPs with a Signing Date before 10/3/2004 will remain unchanged with the single Credit field. 
* See the wireframe for placement. 
* Credits will become Tuition Credits and Living Expenses Credits.

title: As a user I want to see an error when I enter a Total Amount equal to 0
custom_preconds: Given user is on players invoice tab
custom_steps: When user enter the amount equal to 0 on invoice and click save
custom_expected: Error will display message #11

title: As a user I want to see an error when I enter a Net Amount equal to 0
custom_preconds: Given user is on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When clicking Save on an Invoice
custom_expected: *The Net Amount field is present and the Invoice Status = Paid, and the Net Amount equals 0, display an error. Messages #12

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing Living Expenses for a term before the term has ended
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice will check to see if the current date is after the Cutoff Date for the term selected in the invoice (stored in system dates).
custom_expected: *If the current date is not after the Cutoff Date, then display an error. Messages #17

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing Living Expenses higher than the Maximum Allowed
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if the amount entered for Living Expenses on the current invoice will cause the player to exceed the maximum amount allowed for tuition expenses for the selected term. 
* The system will need to check for other existing invoices and credits for the same term (Ex: 2014 Spring Semester), total up all Living expenses entered, and then add the amount of Living expenses entered on this invoice to that total.  
* If this number exceeds the total "Per Semester" or "Per Quarter" Remaining Living Allowance (depending on if this invoice is for a Quarter or a Semester) Amount displayed in the player's CSP Summary, an error is displayed. Messages #25

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing Tuition Expenses higher than the Maximum Allowed
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
*System will check to see if the amount entered for Tuition Expenses (Tuition + Books + Fees) on the current invoice will cause the player to exceed the maximum amount allowed for tuition expenses for the selected term. 
* The system will need to check for other existing invoices and credits for the same term (Ex: 2014 Spring Semester), total up all Tuition, Fees and Book expenses entered, and then add the amount of Tuition, Fees and Book expenses entered on this invoice to that total.  
* If this number exceeds the total "Per Semester" or "Per Quarter" Remaining Tuition Allowance (depending on if this invoice is for a Quarter or a Semester) Amount displayed in the player's CSP Summary, an error is displayed. Messages #24

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing fewer than 5 living expense credits for a quarter
custom_preconds: When user in on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* The system will check to see if ALL of the following are true: 
 -  the amount entered for Living Expenses Credits is less than 5
 -  Semester/Quarter is set to Quarter
 - a value > 0 is entered for Living Expenses
 -  there is not another Invoice for this term with non-zero Living Expenses Credits
* If all of the above are true, then display an error. Messages #33

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing fewer than 6 living expense credits for a semester
custom_preconds: Given user is on Player's Invoice tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* system will check to see if ALL of the following are true: 
 -  the amount entered for Living Expenses Credits is less than 6
 -  Semester/Quarter is set to Semester
 - a value > 0 is entered for Living Expenses
 -  there is not another Invoice for this term with non-zero Living Expenses Credits
* If all of the above are true, then display an error. Messages #35

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing fewer than 5 tuition credits for a quarter
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* The system will check to see if ALL of the following are true: 
 -  the amount entered for Tuition Credits is less than 5
 -  Semester/Quarter is set to Quarter
 - a value > 0 is entered for Tuition OR Fees OR Books
 -  there is not another Invoice for this term with non-zero Tuition Credits
* If all of the above are true, then display an error. Messages #32

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing fewer than 6 tuition credits for a semester
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
*The System will check to see if ALL of the following are true: 
 -  the amount entered for Tuition Credits is less than 6
 -  Semester/Quarter is set to Semester
 - a value > 0 is entered for Tuition OR Fees OR Books
 -  there is not another Invoice for this term with non-zero Tuition Credits
* If all of the above are true, then display an error. Messages #34

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing fewer than 5 credits for a quarter
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date before 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if ALL of the following are true: 
 -  the amount entered for Credits is less than 5
 -  Semester/Quarter is set to Quarter
 -  there is not another Invoice for this term with non-zero Credits
* If yes, display an error. Messages #19

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing fewer than 6 credits for a semester
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date before 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if ALL of the following are true: 
 -  the amount entered for Credits is less than 6

title: As a user I want to see an error when I attempt to enter an Invoice containing living expense credits with no living expenses entered
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player's Invoice  Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date after 10/3/04
custom_expected: *System will check to see if the amount entered for Living Expenses Credits is greater than 0. If yes, and no values >0 exist for Living Expenses, an error is displayed. Messages #36

custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with both "Winter" and "Semester"

title: As a user I want to see useful information in the browser tab for a CSP Invoice and Credit
custom_preconds: Given User is using one of the browser (Safari,Chrome,FireFox)
custom_steps:
When User get to Player's CSP Invoice Tab 
 the browser tab should say "CSP Invoice - Last, Roster First"
- For a credit the browser tab should say "CSP Credit - Last, Roster First"
custom_expected:
*The browser tab should say "CSP Invoice - Last, Roster First"
*The browser tab should say "CSP Credit - Last, Roster First"

title: As a user I want historic CSP Invoice Statuses to be properly reflected
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When There is 1 "Check in Progress" invoice from 1
custom_expected:
* This should be converted to "Paid". (Christopher Parker - invoice created 1/2/06 for 4,333.33 for 2006 - quarter-winter)
* There are 5 "Received" invoices in 1. These should be converted to "Paid". (James Boone - 8/24/09 invoice, Anthony Miller - 1/8/08 and 2/13/08 invoices, Eric Ridener - 12/1/09 invoice, and Zach Strong - 9/22/08 invoice)
* Invoices with a status of canceled should be converted to 2 as "Canceled", but this status will not be used moving forward (should NOT be an option on invoices).

title: As a user I want to be able to calculate the living expenses based on the start and end dates entered on an Invoice
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice tab and viewing an Invoice in edit mode where the Living Expenses field is editable, there is a calculator icon available.
custom_steps: When Clicking on this icon will calculate the living expenses for the invoice by using the entered start date and end date, and multiplying the number of days between the 2 dates by $35.
custom_expected:
* The resulting sum should be populated in the living expenses field. 
* If no start or end date are entered, then this just remains $0.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing CSP invoice (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice tab
custom_steps: When viewing an Invoice in View mode, there will be an Edit button and a Close button in addition to the Print button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Close" will return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the form in edit mode according to the wireframe and data discovery. The fields that are editable and required vary slightly based on the state of the Invoice.
* Club users will not be able to edit any of the fields under the "Payment Details" subsection if the Invoice's status has been previously saved as "Paid". The one exception is the Net Amount field, which should remain editable regardless of state. 
* BOC users will continue to be able to edit all of the fields, regardless of Invoice status.
* Club users are not able to change an Invoice's status from "Paid" back to "Open". 
* When viewing an Invoice in Edit mode, there is a "Save" button, as well as a "Save and Print" button, the Print button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode and no changes will be saved. 
* Clicking "Save" or "Save and Print" will save any changes made to the CSP's invoice. 
* A successful blue save notification will display. 

*Missed AC from create stories, please test*
* When creating a new invoice clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the changes will be lost and they will be taken back to their point of entry.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit an existing CSP invoice (Pre 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When viewing an Invoice in View mode, there will be an Edit button and a Close button in addition to the Print button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Close" will return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Edit" will reload the form in edit mode according to the wireframe and data discovery. The fields that are editable and required vary slightly based on the state of the Invoice.
* Club users will not be able to edit any of the fields under the "Payment Details" subsection if the Invoice's status has been previously saved as "Paid". The one exception is the Net Amount field, which should remain editable regardless of state. 
* BOC users will continue to be able to edit all of the fields, regardless of Invoice status.
* Club users are not able to change an Invoice's status from "Paid" back to "Open". 
* When viewing an Invoice in Edit mode, there is a "Save" button, as well as a "Save and Print" button, the Print button and a "Cancel" button. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the form will reload in View mode and no changes will be saved. 
* Clicking "Save" or "Save and Print" will save any changes made to the CSP's invoice. 
* A successful blue save notification will display.

*Missed AC from create stories, please test*
* When creating a new invoice clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes.  If they confirm, the changes will be lost and they will be taken back to their point of entry.

title: As a user I want to see a warning when I attempt to enter credits on an Invoice for a term for which an invoice already exists
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date before 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if the following are true: 
 - a non-zero value is entered for Credits
 - there are invoices for the same term for which a non-zero value is entered for "Credits". 
* If yes, a warning  is displayed. Messages #38

title: As a user I want to see a warning when I attempt to enter living expense credits on an Invoice for a term for which an invoice with living expenses credits already exists
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if all of the following are true: 
 - a non-zero value is entered for Living Expenses Credits
 - there are invoices for the same academic term for which a non-zero value is entered for "Living Expense Credits" 
* If yes, a warning  is displayed. Messages #21

title: As a user I want to see a warning when I attempt to enter tuition credits on an Invoice for a term for which an invoice with tuition credits already exists
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When Clicking "Save" on an Invoice for a CSP with a Signing Date on or after 10/3/04
custom_expected:
* System will check to see if all of the following are true: 
 - a non-zero value is entered for Tuition Credits
 - there are invoices for the same academic term for which a non-zero value is entered for "Tuition Credits" 
* If yes, a warning  is displayed. Messages #27

title: As a user I want text areas to show more text as text is entered
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN text areas should grow to a max-height of 200px as text is input
AND At 200px any overflow should be shown with a scrollbar
AND View mode should display the same amount of text as in edit mode with a scrollbar for overflow.

title: As a user I want to be able to quickly email an attachment to someone
custom_preconds:
GIVEN User can view attached files and download the attachment they will see an email icon for each attached file


Business Value Description: 
In the current system all files are emailed from Clubs to the BOC and they copy the Player's Union on the files so that they do not have to email them separately. Now that this step has been eliminated, the BOC needs a quick way to email the uploaded files to the Union.
custom_expected:
THEN Clicking on this email icon will launch a pop-up for the user to enter in the desired email address(es), subject and body of an email. 
AND Subject should default to "Last, First - Label" with the "Label" being the selected label on the attached file.
AND Clicking "Send" after populating the required fields will email the uploaded file to the entered address(es). 
AND The email will in some way indicate that it is being sent on behalf of the user, and not just "ebis".

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to show/hide the low-level roles assigned to each user
custom_preconds: Given User is Logged in as BOC
custom_steps: When user click Utilities > User Accounts  there should now be an "IT View" toggle at the top of the User Account page
custom_expected:
* This should default to "Off"
* When this is set to "Off" the user accounts screen will NOT display the low level LDAPs for each user. 
* Switching this to "On" should refresh the page to display the low level LDAPs for each of the users on the page (any filters applied, like Org, should remain applied). 
* Nancy also wants to know if when this is set to "Off" if we can hide the "Misc Permissions", too.

title: As a user I want to be able to export the user accounts page
custom_preconds: Given User on User Account under utilities
custom_steps: When Clicking "Export" will generate an xls export of the user accounts currently visible in the utility per the applied filters, including the "IT View" toggle.
custom_expected: * All users who have access to the User Accounts page should see an "Export" button on the page.

title: As a Club user I don't want to see "Misc Permissions" in the user accounts page
custom_preconds: Given User is Logged in as Club
custom_steps: When user click Utilites > User account >Under Permissions
custom_expected:
* Club users no longer see "Misc Permissions"
* BOC users should continue to see this.

title: As a user I want the accounts listed in the user accounts page to be sorted alphabetically
custom_preconds: Given User is logged in as Club or BOC
custom_steps: When User click Utilities > User Account > Select the org
custom_expected: * Both Club and BOC users should see the User Accounts listing sorted alphabetically by user Last Name, with a secondary sort on First Name.

title: As a user I want to be able to print an Acknowledgment letter from an Invoice (hooking up the print button to the built out letter)
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player Invoice tab
custom_steps: When viewing a CSP Invoice in edit mode, there is a "Print" button.
custom_expected:
* Clicking this button will launch a pop up where the user will have the ability to select the Acknowledgment option to print. 
* The user will also have the ability to choose whether to print in Spanish or English. The default will always be English. 
* The user will also have a space to enter in a Club Contact to print on the Invoice. 
* When the user clicks "Print" with "Acknowledgment" selected, the system will download a pdf of the letter according to the provided specifications to the user's computer. 
* The invoice will display differently based on the signing date of the player's CSP. There are currently 2 different versions of the letter to account for - all detailed in the specifications.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a Questionnaire from the CSP tab of a pro player profile in English
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players Invoice Tab
custom_steps: When "Print Letter" is a button on the CSP tab of the Professional Player Profile
custom_expected:
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Questionnaire" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Questionnaire will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* For the purposes of this story, on "English" is available in the pop-up, and all three radio buttons will work the same and the user will need to enter the address manually (ultimately School/Player will pre-populate these fields but this will be handled in a follow up story). 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Questionnaire in English according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want to be able to prepopulate a school's address on a player letter from the CSP tab
custom_preconds: Given User is on Player CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Selecting a player letter type from the "Print Letter" popover on the CSP tab
custom_expected:
* System will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* Selecting the radio button "School" should allow the user to select which of the stored school addresses should be used in the player letter.
* The school dropdown should be an autocomplete field of all of the available school profiles for CSP. 
* Selecting a school from the dropdown will pre populate the "Pay To", Contact, Fax and Address fields displayed on the pop up using the information entered on the school's profile.  
* The user will be able to adjust these pre populated values and click "Print". 
* The proper values will be used in the printing of the letter.

title: As a user I want to be able to prepopulate a player's address on a player letter from the CSP tab
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players CSP Tab
custom_steps: When Selecting a player letter type from the "Print Letter" popover on the CSP tab
custom_expected:
* System will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* Selecting the radio button "Player" should allow the user to select which of the player's stored addresses should be used in the player letter.
* Selecting a player's address will pre-populate the "Pay To" field withe the player's first and last name, the Address fields displayed with the relevant address selected from the player profile, and the Contact field with the player's first and last name. In the event that the player has a fax number entered, that will also be pre-populated.  
* The user will be able to adjust these pre-populated values and click "Print". 
* The proper values will be used in the printing of the letter.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a Questionnaire from the CSP tab of a pro player profile in Spanish
custom_preconds: Given user is on player CSP Tab
custom_steps: When "Print Letter" is a button on the CSP tab of the Professional Player Profile  And Click "Print Letter"
custom_expected:
*System will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Questionnaire" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Questionnaire will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* Clicking "Print" with "Spanish" selected will generate a pdf of the Questionnaire in Spanish according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want to see the batch complete time on the batches screen
custom_preconds: Given User is on batches screen
custom_steps:
When Change the column header "Date" to "Batch Started"
And Change the column header "Full Run" to "Batch Completed"
custom_expected:
* If the batch completed successfully add the date and time in the "Batch Completed" column
* If the batch did not run fully leave the "Batch Completed" column blank

title: As a user I do not want the player static header to take up my entire screen when navigating player profile tabs on screens smaller than 768px
custom_preconds: Given User is on Players profile and screen widths is smaller then 768px
custom_steps: When Clicking on a player name in the profile should still navigate to the Player History tab, even if Summary Info is the first link in the popover
custom_expected:
* Show a "Summary Info" link in the mobile tab popover
* Clicking on the Summary Info link will open a new tab per the wireframe

title: As a user I want all form sections collapsed by default on screen resolutions smaller than 768px
